intro: Chilita barbata, commonly known as the hairy chilita, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in fine, hairy textures, which help reduce water loss in its native arid environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chilita barbata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in regions with low rainfall.
